title: Tracking Issue for `x suggest`

labels.name: E-easy
labels.description: Call for participation: Experience needed to fix: Easy / not much (good first issue)

labels.name: E-mentor
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue has a mentor. Use RustcContributor::new on Zulip for discussion.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-help-wanted
labels.description: Call for participation: Help is requested to fix this issue.

labels.name: T-bootstrap
labels.description: Relevant to the bootstrap subteam: Rust's build system (x.py and src/bootstrap)

labels.name: T-libs
labels.description: Relevant to the library team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Tracking issue for `x suggest` subcommand and implementation of recommendations. Note that this isn't a traditional tracking issue for a feature but just a place to keep track of implementation. 

See the [zulip stream](https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/122651-general/topic/tool.20to.20suggest.20subset.20of.20tests) and the [initial issue](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/97339) for more information and rationale about this change.

- [x] Initial PR (#106249)
- [x] `rustc-dev-guide` (rust-lang/rustc-dev-guide#1660)
- [ ] `tidy` lint for suggestion tests, do we want this?
- [ ] Further suggestions

cc @albertlarsan68 @jyn514
